tool.name: trimAl
tool.command:
trimal -in '$in' -out '$trimmed_output' ${out_format_selector}
#unless $trimming_mode.mode_selector == "manual" -htmlout '$html_summary' #end unless
#if $trimming_mode.mode_selector == "custom" -gapthreshold $trimming_mode.gapthreshold -simthreshold $trimming_mode.simthreshold -cons $trimming_mode.cons
#if $trimming_mode.w -w $trimming_mode.w #else #if $trimming_mode.gw -gw $trimming_mode.gw #end if #if $trimming_mode.sw -sw $trimming_mode.sw #end if #if $trimming_mode.cw -cw $trimming_mode.cw #end if #end if #else if $trimming_mode.mode_selector == "manual" #if $trimming_mode.selectcols -selectcols { $trimming_mode.selectcols } #end if #if $trimming_mode.selectseqs -selectseqs { $trimming_mode.selectseqs } #end if #else $trimming_mode.mode_selector #end if
#if $resoverlap -resoverlap $resoverlap #end if #if $seqoverlap -seqoverlap $seqoverlap #end if
#if $statistics -sgc -sgt -ssc -sst -sident -soverlap | tee '$statsout' #end if

param.label: Alignment file (clustal, fasta, NBRF/PIR, nexus, phylip3.2, phylip)

param.name: mode_selector
param.label: Select trimming mode from the list
param.option: nogaps - remove all positions with gaps in the alignment.
noallgaps - remove columns composed only by gaps.
gappyout - only uses information based on gaps' distribution.
strict - combine gappyout trimming with subsequent trimming based on an automatically selected similarity threshold.
strictplus - very similar to the strict method but the final step of the algorithm is slightly different.
automated1 - heuristic approach to determine the optimal automatic method for trimming a given alignment.
custom mode - define trimming parameters yourself.
manual mode - specify columns or sequences to remove

param.label: Columns to be removed from alignment

validator.message: must be comma-separated list of whole numbers

param.label: Sequences to be removed from alignment

validator.message: must be comma-separated list of whole numbers

param.label: Gap threshold
param.help: 1 - (fraction of sequences with a gap allowed).

param.label: Consistency Threshold. Minimum consistency value required
param.help: Range: [0 - 1]. Not allowed in combination with inputfile.

param.label: Minimum conservance percentage
param.help: Minimum percentage of the positions in the original alignment to conserve.

param.label: Clusters. Get the most Nth representatives sequences from a given alignment.
Max Identity. Get the representatives sequences for a given identity threshold.
Window frame size - general
param.help: score of position i is the average of the window (i - n) to (i + n). Will override specific sizes set below

param.label: Window frame size applied to Gaps
param.help: score of position i is the average of the window (i - n) to (i + n).

param.label: Window frame size applied to Similarity
param.help: score of position i is the average of the window (i - n) to (i + n).

param.label: Window frame size applied to Consistency
param.help: score of position i is the average of the window (i - n) to (i + n).

param.label: Residue overlap
param.help: Minimum overlap of a positions with other positions in the column to be considered a “good position”. Range: [0-1]. Must be used in combination with Sequence overlap.

param.label: Sequence overlap
param.help: Minimum percentage of “good positions” that a sequence must have in order to be conserved. Range: [0-100]. Must be used in combination with Residue overlap.

PHYLIP format compatible with PAML. Sequences name length up to 10 characters.

tool.help:
TrimAl is a tool for the automated removal of spurious sequences or poorly aligned regions from a multiple sequence alignment.
TrimAl can consider several parameters, alone or in multiple combinations, in order to select the most-reliable positions in the alignment. These include the proportion of sequences with a gap, the level of residue similarity and, if several alignments for the same set of sequences are provided, the consistency level of columns among alignments. Moreover, trimAl allows to manually select a set of columns and sequences to be removed from the alignment.
TrimAl implements a series of automated algorithms that trim the alignment searching for optimum thresholds based on inherent characteristics of the input alignment, to be used so that the signal-to-noise ratio after alignment trimming phase is increased. Learn more about the available trimming modes here: https://trimal.readthedocs.io/en/latest/algorithms.html
Among trimAl's additional features, trimAl allows:
- getting the complementary alignment (columns that were trimmed), - to compute statistics from the alignment, - to select the output file format, - to get a summary of trimAl's trimming in HTML and SVG formats, - and many other options.
TrimAl webpage: https://trimal.readthedocs.io
